title: Decade Music Recall
description: Can you place these hit songs in the right decade?

questions.question: In which decade was 'Bohemian Rhapsody' by Queen released?
questions.explanation: 'Bohemian Rhapsody' was released in 1975 as part of Queen's album 'A Night at the Opera.'

questions.question: In which decade did Elvis Presley release 'Jailhouse Rock'?
questions.explanation: 'Jailhouse Rock' was released in 1957 and became one of Elvis Presley's most iconic rock and roll hits.

questions.question: In which decade was 'I Will Always Love You' a massive hit for Whitney Houston?
questions.explanation: Whitney Houston's version of 'I Will Always Love You' was released in 1992 for 'The Bodyguard' soundtrack. The song was originally written and recorded by Dolly Parton in 1973.

questions.question: In which decade did The Beatles release 'Hey Jude'?
questions.explanation: 'Hey Jude' was released by The Beatles in 1968. It was written by Paul McCartney to comfort John Lennon's son Julian during his parents' divorce.

questions.question: In which decade was 'Stayin' Alive' by the Bee Gees released?
questions.explanation: 'Stayin' Alive' was released in 1977 as part of the 'Saturday Night Fever' soundtrack, becoming an anthem of the disco era.

questions.question: In which decade was 'Billie Jean' by Michael Jackson released?
questions.explanation: 'Billie Jean' was released in 1983 from Michael Jackson's legendary album 'Thriller.'

questions.question: In which decade did Simon & Garfunkel release 'Bridge Over Troubled Water'?
questions.explanation: 'Bridge Over Troubled Water' was released in January 1970 as the title track of Simon & Garfunkel's final studio album.

questions.question: In which decade was 'Hotel California' by the Eagles first released?
questions.explanation: 'Hotel California' was released in 1977 and won the Grammy Award for Record of the Year in 1978.

questions.question: In which decade did Nirvana release 'Smells Like Teen Spirit'?
questions.explanation: 'Smells Like Teen Spirit' was released in 1991 on Nirvana's album 'Nevermind,' and is often credited with launching the grunge movement into the mainstream.

questions.question: In which decade was 'My Girl' by The Temptations released?
questions.explanation: 'My Girl' was released in 1964 by The Temptations. Written by Smokey Robinson, it became the group's first number-one hit.

questions.question: In which decade was 'What a Wonderful World' by Louis Armstrong released?
questions.explanation: 'What a Wonderful World' was released in 1967. It initially wasn't a hit in the U.S. but became hugely popular after being featured in the 1987 film 'Good Morning, Vietnam.'

questions.question: In which decade was 'Take On Me' by a-ha released?
questions.explanation: 'Take On Me' by Norwegian band a-ha was released in 1985. Its innovative music video combining live action and pencil-sketch animation became iconic.

questions.question: In which decade was 'Respect' by Aretha Franklin released?
questions.explanation: 'Respect' was released by Aretha Franklin in 1967. Originally written by Otis Redding, Aretha's version became a feminist and civil rights anthem.

questions.question: In which decade did Fleetwood Mac release 'Dreams'?
questions.explanation: 'Dreams' by Fleetwood Mac was released in 1977 on the album 'Rumours.' It was the band's only number-one single in the United States.

questions.question: In which decade was 'Unchained Melody' originally released by The Righteous Brothers?
questions.explanation: 'Unchained Melody' was recorded by The Righteous Brothers in 1965. The song gained renewed popularity in 1990 when it was featured in the film 'Ghost.'
